deck.name: A2 – Elementary Vocabulary
deck.description: Elementary: expand your range with travel, shopping, routines, and simple descriptions.

cards.definition: a piece of paper that allows you to travel or enter
cards.context: I bought a train ticket online.

cards.definition: an official document for international travel
cards.context: Do not forget your passport at the airport.
My luggage is very heavy.

cards.definition: a large bag with a handle for travel
cards.context: I packed my suitcase last night.
The flight to New York takes eight hours.

cards.definition: a car that takes passengers for money
cards.context: We took a taxi to the hotel.

cards.definition: a two-wheeled vehicle powered by pedaling
cards.context: She rides her bicycle to work.

cards.definition: an act of traveling from one place to another
cards.context: The journey took three hours.

cards.definition: a drawing that shows roads and places
cards.context: I used a map to find the museum.

cards.definition: to go from one place to another
cards.context: I love to travel to new countries.
We arrive at the airport at noon.
The train departs at 9:15.
Can you give me directions to the museum?

cards.definition: to go from one side to the other
cards.context: Cross the street at the traffic lights.

cards.definition: a structure built over a river or road
cards.context: We walked across the old bridge.
There is a lot of traffic in the morning.
We need to stop for petrol.
This road leads to the beach.

cards.definition: the point where two streets meet
cards.context: The café is on the corner.

cards.definition: the amount of money something costs
cards.context: What is the price of this jacket?

cards.definition: to give something in exchange for money
cards.context: They sell fresh bread every morning.

cards.definition: a person who buys goods or services
cards.context: The customer asked for a receipt.

cards.definition: a paper showing what you bought and paid
cards.context: Keep the receipt in case you want a refund.

cards.definition: how big or small something is
cards.context: What size shirt do you wear?

cards.definition: a container for carrying shopping items
cards.context: I put the fruit in the basket.

cards.definition: coins you get back after paying
cards.context: Here is your change.

cards.definition: a reduction in the usual price
cards.context: There is a 20 percent discount today.

cards.definition: to use money to buy things
cards.context: I spend too much money on clothes.

cards.definition: the amount of money needed for something
cards.context: How much does this book cost?
Can I pay by card?
I prefer to pay in cash.

cards.definition: a large shop selling food and household items
cards.context: I go to the supermarket every Saturday.
Eating fruit keeps you healthy.
She is ill and cannot go to school.
I have a pain in my back.

cards.definition: a substance used to treat illness
cards.context: Take your medicine after breakfast.

cards.definition: a person who treats sick people
cards.context: I have an appointment with the doctor.

cards.definition: a person who cares for sick people
cards.context: The nurse checked my temperature.
I go to the dentist twice a year.

cards.definition: a measure of heat or fever
cards.context: She has a high temperature.
I have a headache from the noise.

cards.definition: the organ where food is digested
cards.context: My stomach hurts after eating too much.

cards.definition: a common illness with a runny nose
cards.context: I caught a cold last week.
You need to rest when you are ill.
I do exercise three times a week.

cards.definition: to feel pain or cause pain
cards.context: My knee hurts when I run.

cards.definition: one of the hard white parts in your mouth
cards.context: The child lost a tooth yesterday.

cards.definition: the red liquid flowing through the body
cards.context: The nurse took a blood test.

cards.definition: the part of the body connecting head to shoulders
cards.context: She has a pain in her neck.

cards.definition: one of the five parts at the end of the hand
cards.context: He cut his finger with a knife.

cards.definition: the joint connecting arm to body
cards.context: He put his hand on my shoulder.

cards.definition: the joint in the middle of the leg
cards.context: She fell and hurt her knee.

cards.definition: the outer covering of the body
cards.context: Protect your skin from the sun.

cards.definition: an activity you enjoy in your free time
cards.context: My hobby is reading books.
Football is a popular sport.

cards.definition: a team sport played with a round ball
cards.context: We play football every weekend.

cards.definition: sounds arranged in a pleasing way
cards.context: I listen to music while studying.

cards.definition: a film shown at a cinema
cards.context: We watched a movie last night.

cards.definition: an activity you play for fun
cards.context: The children are playing a board game.

cards.definition: a picture taken with a camera
cards.context: She took a photo of the sunset.
I bought a new camera for my trip.

cards.definition: a string instrument for making music
cards.context: He plays the guitar very well.

cards.definition: to make a picture with a pen or pencil
cards.context: She likes to draw animals.

cards.definition: to make a picture using colors
cards.context: He paints landscapes on the weekend.

cards.definition: a printed publication with articles and pictures
cards.context: She reads a fashion magazine.

cards.definition: a printed daily publication with news
cards.context: He reads the newspaper every morning.

cards.definition: a place where you watch movies
cards.context: We go to the cinema on Fridays.

cards.definition: a building where historical objects are displayed
cards.context: The museum has a great art collection.
We went to a concert in the park.

cards.definition: a time of rest from work; a vacation
cards.context: We are going on holiday next month.

cards.definition: a social event with food, drink, and fun
cards.context: She is having a birthday party.

cards.definition: a request to attend an event
cards.context: I received an invitation to the wedding.

cards.definition: to do something special for a happy event
cards.context: We celebrate Christmas with our family.
She is tall and thin.

cards.definition: having a lot of body weight
cards.context: The cat is getting fat.
He is very strong.
She feels weak after the illness.
He became rich through hard work.
They were poor but happy.
This box is very heavy.
This bag is light and easy to carry.
The exam was really hard.
The pillow is very soft.
It gets dark early in winter.

cards.definition: giving out a lot of light
cards.context: The sun is very bright today.

cards.definition: having a large distance from side to side
cards.context: The river is very wide here.

cards.definition: having a small distance from side to side
cards.context: The street is too narrow for cars.
The table is round.
The road is flat and easy to cycle on.
The swimming pool is two meters deep.
The clothes are dry now.
The grass is wet from the rain.

cards.definition: recently made or picked; not old
cards.context: I buy fresh vegetables at the market.
We had a wonderful time at the beach.
The weather was terrible yesterday.
The food tasted horrible.
What a lovely day!
I heard a strange noise last night.
It is normal to feel nervous.
Today is a special day.
This café is very popular.
Paris is famous for the Eiffel Tower.
The hotel is very modern.
The recipe is very simple.
This chair is very comfortable.
The movie was boring.
The party was really fun.
He is always polite to everyone.
It is rude to talk during a movie.
Be careful when crossing the road.
Swimming in the river is dangerous.
You are lucky to have such a nice family.

cards.definition: able to happen or be done
cards.context: Is it possible to change my seat?
It is impossible to finish today.
Are you sure about that?
I am certain she will come.

cards.definition: not wanting to work or be active
cards.context: He felt lazy on Sunday morning.
That joke was very funny.
She was angry about the mistake.
The child is afraid of the dark.
I am excited about the trip.
She was surprised by the gift.
I am worried about the exam.
Her parents are proud of her.
She lives alone in a small flat.
Our teacher is very patient.
She is a university student.

cards.definition: a group of students or a lesson
cards.context: My English class starts at two.

cards.definition: a period of learning or teaching
cards.context: The lesson lasted one hour.
I have an exam next week.

cards.definition: work given to students to do at home
cards.context: I have to do my homework tonight.

cards.definition: a set of questions to check knowledge
cards.context: The test was easier than expected.
He works for a big company.

cards.definition: a gathering of people to discuss things
cards.context: I have a meeting at three.

cards.definition: the person in charge at work
cards.context: My boss is on holiday this week.
He gets his salary at the end of the month.
My colleague helped me with the project.

cards.definition: a meeting to decide if someone gets a job
cards.context: I have a job interview tomorrow.
She has five years of experience.
It was a difficult decision.
Everyone makes mistakes sometimes.
Practice makes perfect.
Hard work leads to success.
She studies law at university.
I agree with your idea.
The bus arrives at ten.
I believe you are right.
This pen belongs to Maria.

cards.definition: to take something with the plan to return it
cards.context: Can I borrow your dictionary?
Be careful not to break the glass.
They are building a new school.
She tried to catch the ball.
Please check your email.
You can choose any color.
I clean my room every Saturday.

cards.definition: to go up using hands and feet
cards.context: We climbed to the top of the hill.
She collects stamps as a hobby.

cards.definition: to look at similarities and differences
cards.context: Compare the two pictures.

cards.definition: to say you are unhappy about something
cards.context: He complained about the noise.
Please continue reading.

cards.definition: to make something the same as the original
cards.context: Copy the sentences into your notebook.
The teacher corrected our work.
Can you count to one hundred?

cards.definition: to place something over or on
cards.context: Cover the food to keep it warm.

cards.definition: to produce tears from the eyes
cards.context: The baby started to cry.

cards.definition: to divide with a sharp tool
cards.context: Cut the bread into slices.
I cannot decide what to wear.

cards.definition: to say what something is like
cards.context: Describe your best friend.
I discovered a great café nearby.
We discussed the plan at the meeting.

cards.definition: to see images while sleeping; to wish for
cards.context: I dream of traveling the world.
She dropped her phone on the floor.
I enjoy cooking Italian food.
Please enter through the main door.
Can you explain this word to me?
Fill the glass with water.
He fixed the broken chair.
Follow me, I will show you the way.
I always forget my password.
Children grow quickly.

cards.definition: to give an answer without being sure
cards.context: Guess how old I am.
What happened yesterday?
I hate getting up early.
I hope the weather will be nice.

cards.definition: to move or do things quickly
cards.context: Hurry up, we are late!

cards.definition: to form a picture in your mind
cards.context: Imagine living near the beach.
The price includes breakfast.

cards.definition: to ask someone to come somewhere
cards.context: I invited my friends to dinner.

cards.definition: to become part of a group
cards.context: Would you like to join us for lunch?
Keep the change.

cards.definition: to hit a door or surface with your hand
cards.context: Someone is knocking on the door.

cards.definition: to make sounds when something is funny
cards.context: The joke made everyone laugh.
Can you lend me ten euros?

cards.definition: to be in a flat position; to not tell the truth
cards.context: I like to lie on the beach.

cards.definition: to not be able to find something
cards.context: I always lose my keys.

cards.definition: to feel sad about absence; to fail to catch
cards.context: I miss my family when I travel.
Did you notice the new painting?
He offered me a cup of coffee.

cards.definition: to request food or a product
cards.context: I ordered pizza for dinner.
She owns a small business.
Pick a card, any card.

cards.definition: to decide what you will do
cards.context: We plan to leave early.

cards.definition: to like one thing more than another
cards.context: I prefer tea to coffee.
She prepared a nice dinner.

cards.definition: to say you will definitely do something
cards.context: I promise to call you tonight.
Pull the door to open it.

cards.definition: to move something away from you
cards.context: Push the button to start.

cards.definition: to get something that is given or sent
cards.context: I received a letter from my friend.

cards.definition: to know someone or something from before
cards.context: I did not recognize her with short hair.
I remember our first meeting.

cards.definition: to fix something that is broken
cards.context: He repaired the bicycle.
We return home on Sunday.

cards.definition: to make the sound of a bell
cards.context: The phone is ringing.

cards.definition: to keep something for later use
cards.context: I save money every month.

cards.definition: to look carefully to find something
cards.context: She searched for her keys everywhere.

cards.definition: to use or have something with others
cards.context: We share a room at the hotel.
Do not shout in the library.

cards.definition: to make a happy expression with your mouth
cards.context: She smiled when she saw the flowers.

cards.definition: to try food or drink; the flavor of something
cards.context: Taste this soup, it is delicious.

cards.definition: to send through the air with force
cards.context: Throw the ball to me.

cards.definition: to put your hand on something
cards.context: Do not touch the painting.

cards.definition: to go to see a person or place
cards.context: We visit our grandparents every Sunday.
I wake up at six every day.
I wish I could travel more.
Do not worry, everything will be fine.

cards.definition: to stop sleeping and get out of bed
cards.context: I wake up at 6:30 every morning.
I get dressed before breakfast.
Brush your teeth twice a day.

cards.definition: to wash your body under running water
cards.context: I take a shower every morning.

cards.definition: a piece of cloth for drying
cards.context: Hand me a towel, please.

cards.definition: a glass surface that reflects images
cards.context: She looked at herself in the mirror.

cards.definition: the surface you walk on inside
cards.context: Please clean the kitchen floor.

cards.definition: a vertical surface of a room or building
cards.context: There is a map on the wall.
Take the stairs to the second floor.
Turn on the lamp, it is dark.
We sat on the sofa and watched TV.

cards.definition: a machine for keeping food cold
cards.context: The milk is in the fridge.

cards.definition: a heated space for cooking food
cards.context: Bake the cake in the oven for 30 minutes.
Put the food on a plate.

cards.definition: a tool with a blade for cutting
cards.context: Cut the bread with a knife.

cards.definition: a tool with prongs for eating
cards.context: Use a fork to eat the salad.

cards.definition: a tool with a round end for eating soup
cards.context: Stir the soup with a spoon.

cards.definition: a device for turning things on or off
cards.context: The light switch is next to the door.

cards.definition: a device for securing a door
cards.context: Lock the door when you leave.
Put the rubbish in the bin.

cards.definition: electronic mail sent via the internet
cards.context: I will send you an email tonight.

cards.definition: a piece of information sent to someone
cards.context: She left a message on my phone.
I use the internet every day.

cards.definition: an electronic device for processing data
cards.context: I work on my computer all day.

cards.definition: the display part of a device
cards.context: The screen of my phone is broken.

cards.definition: a page or group of pages on the internet
cards.context: Check the hotel website for prices.

cards.definition: a secret word for accessing an account
cards.context: Do not share your password.
My phone battery is low.

cards.definition: a written message, usually sent by post
cards.context: I wrote a letter to my grandmother.

cards.definition: a notice giving information or instructions
cards.context: The sign says no parking.
I watch the news every evening.

cards.definition: something given to someone; a present
cards.context: She gave me a gift for my birthday.
You will have another chance to try.

cards.definition: a way in which things are not the same
cards.context: What is the difference between these two?

cards.definition: something that shows what others are like
cards.context: Can you give me an example?
It is a fact that the Earth is round.

cards.definition: a number of people or things together
cards.context: A group of students visited the museum.
Reading before bed is a good habit.
In my opinion, this is the best restaurant.

cards.definition: the cause or explanation for something
cards.context: What is the reason for the delay?

cards.definition: something that happens because of something else
cards.context: The result of the test was good.

cards.definition: an instruction that must be followed
cards.context: You must follow the school rules.
What sort of music do you like?
The meeting will begin at two.
The class ends at three.
She seems very happy today.

cards.definition: after a long time; at last
cards.context: We finally arrived at the hotel.
Perhaps we can meet next week.
The film was quite good.
I like fruit, especially strawberries.
I am almost finished.
I had tea instead of coffee.
I recently started a new job.
She walked towards the park.

cards.definition: from one side to the other
cards.context: The shop is across the street.
We walked along the river.
There are shops around the corner.
The car park is behind the hotel.
The plane flew above the clouds.
The temperature is below zero.
The children are playing outside.
Come inside, it is raining.

cards.definition: moving from one side to another
cards.context: We walked through the forest.
I fell asleep during the movie.

cards.definition: up to the point in time that
cards.context: Wait here until I come back.
I have lived here since 2015.
I read while I waited.

cards.definition: in spite of the fact that
cards.context: Although it was cold, we went for a walk.
The hotel was expensive. However, the service was excellent.
I actually enjoyed the concert.
It rained, but we went anyway.

cards.definition: not one and not the other
cards.context: Neither answer is correct.

cards.definition: one or the other of two
cards.context: You can sit on either side.
What else do you need?
Everyone came except Tom.
